intro: Peritassa laevigata subsp. obtusa, commonly known as the broad-leaved peritassa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its large, broad leaves that are typically smooth and dark green in color. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the carrot family. It is native to parts of southern Africa, where it thrives in moist, well-drained soils. This subspecies is often found in woodland and grassland habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its native environment.
